result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Sonnyboy Lyons was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Robert Sonnyboy Lyons

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges by 5/26/2016 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.
Consecutive to: CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 33 days served; with release only to the Day Reporting Center.  Court recommends against electronic monitoring.

Court does not suspend driving privileges.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

records.addlTxt: DENYING request for release on electronic monitoring.  Signed and filed. lms
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Ellen R. Brostrom, Br. 6, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request for electronic monitoring.

Defendant Robert Sonnyboy Lyons in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Robert Sonnyboy Lyons in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant is charges with a new case in Vilas County.    The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing.
Court sentenced defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 33 days served; with release only to the Day Reporting Center.  Court recommends against electronic monitoring. 

Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges by 5/26/2016 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Court does not suspend driving privileges.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice and ACknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.

Attorney Daryl A Kastenson in court, defendant Robert Sonnyboy Lyons not in court, in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  OFF THE RECORD.    Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  Review hearing scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court orders a $10,000.00 cash bail with turnover to JusticePoint.

Defendant Robert Sonnyboy Lyons in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Robert Sonnyboy Lyons in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Court vacates the warrant.   Defendant is being charges with another case in Vilas county and has been referred to DTC.  State is not revoking as of yet.  Review hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Court issued a warrant on 1/12/2015  Defendant is currently in custody on warrant.  Case is adjourned for a Return on Warrant on 5/12/2015, in br. 6.  Parties notified.  lms
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Daryl A. Kastenson in court.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant is tending to another charge in Vilas county.    Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.

Defendant Robert Sonnyboy Lyons in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant is enrolled in AODA counseling and being tested by local clinic.  No reports are received.  Defense to get a release to get the reports.  Defendant to begin community service.  Review hearing scheduled for January 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Robert Sonnyboy Lyons in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement.
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, pled GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the case transferred to Judge Brostrom, Branch 6 for a review hearing on 12/9/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  aw  Review hearing scheduled for December 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Robert Sonnyboy Lyons in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Present in court is Justice Point Case Worker Tiffany Thompson.  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  No action taken at this time.  Case remains calendared for Deferred Prosection Agreement Hearing on October 15, 2014 at 1:30 pm in Branch 3
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Robert Sonnyboy Lyons in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin  for Zachary Wittchow.
Court is in trial.  Defense counsel needs to talk with ADA Wittchow.  Defense also needs to find a monitoring agency.  Case adjourned for DPA hearing on 10/15/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  aw  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

NO FILE IN COURT.  Defendant tested positive for THC, cocaine, and opiates.  Bail is modified.  Defendant taken into custody.  aw

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing.   Court ordered no possession or use of illegal and controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Robert Sonnyboy Lyons in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Defendant Robert Sonnyboy Lyons in custody.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant came in late yesterday after a warrant was issued.  Court cancels warrant.  Case adjourned for DPA hearing on 9/25/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  Court will not approve a DPA again if the defendant does not appear on the next court date.  aw  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.

Defendant Robert Sonnyboy Lyons in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Stephan Nolten.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  State has offered defendant a DPA.  Case adjourned for DPA hearing on 8/13/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for August 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Robert Sonnyboy Lyons in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Danielle Chojnacki for Stephan E Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 5/7/14.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Robert Sonnyboy Lyons in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Robert Sonnyboy Lyons in custody.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
